title: Steven Spielbergâ€™s UFO Movie â€˜Disclosure Dayâ€™ Revealed as Trailer Shows Emily Blunt and Josh Oâ€™Connor Making Contact With Aliens
description:
Universal Pictures has released the first trailer for Steven Spielbergâ€˜s next film, â€œDisclosure Day.â€

	The movie stars Emily Blunt, Josh Oâ€™Connor,
body:
Universal Pictures has released the first trailer for Steven Spielbergâ€˜s next film, â€œDisclosure Day.â€

	The movie stars Emily Blunt, Josh Oâ€™Connor, Colin Firth, Eve Hewson, Colman Domingo, Wyatt Russell and Henry Lloyd-Hughes. Spielberg developed the science fiction story with screenwriter David Koepp, who previously collaborated with the director as a writer on â€œJurassic Park,â€ â€œJurassic Park: The Lost World,â€ â€œWar of the Worldsâ€ and â€œIndiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull.â€
	

	Hereâ€™s the logline: â€œIf you found out we werenâ€™t alone, if someone showed you, proved it to you, would that frighten you? This summer, the truth belongs to seven billion people. We are coming close to â€¦ â€˜Disclosure Day.'â€


	â€œDisclosure Dayâ€ is the 37th film that Spielberg has directed since his (partially lost) debut in 1964 â€” coincidentally, that initial feature, â€œFirelight,â€ was also a science fiction film. He has returned to the genre in several films over the years including the two â€œJurassic Parkâ€ movies and â€œWar of the Worldsâ€ as well as â€œClose Encounters of the Third Kind,â€ â€œE.T. the Extra-Terrestrial,â€ â€œMinority Report,â€ â€œA.I. Artificial Intelligenceâ€ and â€œReady Player One.â€

	The cumulative box office gross of Spielbergâ€™s directing filmography is over $10 billion worldwide. As a director and producer, he has been nominated for over 23 Academy Awards, taking home three including best director wins for â€œSchindlerâ€™s Listâ€ and â€œSaving Private Ryanâ€ in 1993 and 1998, respectively.

	His most recent film, 2023â€™s semi-autobiographical â€œThe Fabelmansâ€ grossed $45 million and was nominated for seven Academy Awards, including best picture.
	

	Universal will release â€œDisclosure Dayâ€ in theaters on June 12. It is produced by Spielberg alongside Kristie Macosko Krieger at Amblin Entertainment.

	Watch the trailer below.

schema.headline: Steven Spielbergâ€™s UFO Movie â€˜Disclosure Dayâ€™ Revealed as Trailer Shows Emily Blunt and Josh Oâ€™Connor Making Contact With Aliens

title: Publicists Rhett Usry and Amanda Pelletier Join Origin Public Relations
description:
Publicity veterans Rhett Usry and Amanda Pelletier have joined Origin Public Relations.

	Usry has been named president and will lead the agencyâ€™s N
body:
Publicity veterans Rhett Usry and Amanda Pelletier have joined Origin Public Relations.

	Usry has been named president and will lead the agencyâ€™s New York office. Pelletier is a senior publicist, based in Los Angeles.

	â€œRhettâ€™s experience, perspective, and industry relationships make him anÂ invaluable additionÂ as we continue to grow in an ever-evolving media landscape,â€Â Origin foundersÂ Lindsay Krug and Rachel Karten said in a statement Tuesday. â€œAmanda is an exceptional publicist with the exact mix of strategy, heart, and creativity that defines Origin. Both Rhett and Amanda have long been respected across the industry for their strategic approach and their proven ability to run successful, high-impact publicity campaigns. Their arrival marks an exciting new chapter for Origin as we broaden our reach and strengthen our capabilities.â€
	

	At Origin, Usry continues to work with Oscar nominee Danielle Brooks, Emmy winners Kristen Johnston, Kyra Sedgwick and Ilana Glazer, four-time NAACP Image Award winner Nia Long, as well as Caleb Hearon, Claudia Doumit, Jen Tullock, Kerri Kenney-Silver, Krysten Ritter and Vella Lovell.Â He was most recently at Narrative for two years andÂ ID for 13 years,Â where he served as a VP of talent and led the music department.


	PelletierÂ continues to represent Mae Martin, Devery Jacobs, J. Smith-Cameron, Eden Sher, Nicole Maines, Justin Johnson Cortez and Ari Notartomaso. Pelletier began her career in music PR in New York before joining the publicity departments at HarperCollins Publishers and later at Simon & Schuster.Â 
	

	Krug and Karten launched Origin in March 2023.

schema.headline: Publicists Rhett Usry and Amanda Pelletier Join Origin Public Relations

title: Netflix Inks iHeartMedia Deal for Exclusive Video Podcasts Featuring Charlamagne tha God, Chelsea Handler and More
description: Netflix is plugging more podcasts into its programming lineup through an exclusive video podcast deal with iHeartMedia, including popular radio talk
body:
Netflix is plugging more podcasts into its programming lineup through an exclusive video podcast deal with iHeartMedia, including popular radio talk show â€œThe Breakfast Clubâ€ co-hosted by Charlamange tha God and Chelsea Handlerâ€˜s weekly podcast.

	Under the pact, video versions of more than 15 iHeartMedia original podcasts will stream in only on Netflix worldwide, including â€œThe Breakfast Club,â€ â€œMy Favorite Murder,â€ â€œBobby Bones Presents: The Bobbycast,â€ â€œBehind the Bastards,â€ â€œDear Chelseaâ€ with Chelsea Handler, and â€œThis Is Importantâ€ with â€œWorkaholicsâ€ stars Adam Devine, Anders Holm and Blake Anderson.
	

	The deal is similar to the one Netflix reached with Spotify stream a collection of original podcasts on Netflix worldwide, starting in 2026 with titles including â€œThe Bill Simmons Podcast,â€ â€œThe Rewatchablesâ€ and true-crime series â€œSerial Killers.â€


	New iHeartMedia video podcast episodes will launch on Netflix in early 2026 in the U.S., with more markets to follow. iHeartMedia retains all audio-only rights and distribution for the shows included in the deal. All podcasts will continue to be available on the iHeartRadio app and other audio platforms, including Apple Podcasts and Spotify.

	â€œWith this partnership we are incredibly excited to offer our members such unmatched variety, and to deliver highly entertaining podcasts featuring some of the worldâ€™s most dynamic personalities,â€ Lauren Smith, Netflix VP of content licensing and programming strategy, said in a statement. â€œGet ready to dive in with the true crime phenomenon â€˜My Favorite Murder,â€™ the dynamic perspectives of â€˜The Breakfast Club,â€™ and the sharp, unfiltered comedy of Chelsea Handler in this initial collection.â€
	

	Bob Pittman, CEO of iHeartMedia, said audio podcasting has been the fastest-growing medium over the past 20 years. Now, he said, â€œweâ€™re thrilled to expand that experience with an exciting new category â€” video podcasts,â€ Pittman said. 

	â€œNetflix has a leading video-first service, and this partnership perfectly complements our strong audio foundation,â€ said Pittman. â€œWorking with Netflix â€” an important leader in entertainment â€” gives fans one more way to connect with the personalities they love and opens the door to new audiences, including viewers discovering these shows for the first time.â€

	The lineup includes the following podcasts (with descriptions provided by iHeartMedia):


â€œThe Breakfast Club,â€ the radio replay podcast that recently surpassed 1 billion downloads features hosts DJ Envy, Jess Hilarious, Loren LoRosa and Charlamagne tha God breaking down the latest in news and culture.
â€œBobby Bones Presents: The Bobbycast,â€ the hit music and entertainment podcast, features host Bobby Bonesâ€”radio and TV personality, two-time New York Times best-selling author, and youngest-ever National Radio Hall of Fame inducteeâ€”sitting down with some of the biggest names in music and entertainment.
â€œMy Favorite Murder,â€ a hit original true crime show with approximately two billion lifetime downloads featuring hosts Karen Kilgariff and Georgia Hardstark.
â€œDear Chelsea,â€ a weekly advice show with host Chelsea Handler answering listener questions alongside celebrity guests.
â€œJoe and Jada,â€ Grammy-nominated music superstars Fat Joe and Jadakiss to link up twice a week to discuss the news dominating music, sports and culture and interview influential figures across those sectors for candid and compelling conversations.
â€œThis Is Important,â€ a hit comedy podcast, features â€œWorkaholicsâ€ stars Adam Devine, Anders Holm and Blake Anderson seriously discussing some very important topics.
â€œThe Psychology of Your 20s,â€ the top-ranked mental health podcast, is a biweekly guide to surviving growing pains through psychology with host Jemma Sbeg.
â€œBehind the Bastards,â€ a fan-favorite history podcast, goes into the bizarre realities that formed the lives of some very bad people with host Robert Evans.
â€œStuff They Donâ€™t Want You to Know,â€ a curiosity podcast, delves into the unexplained with hosts Matt Frederick, Ben Bowlin and Noel Brown.
â€œStuff You Missed in History Class,â€ a curiosity podcast, sees hosts Holly Frey and Tracy Wilson recount the strangest, most unusual untold stories that werenâ€™t covered in school.
â€œStuff To Blow Your Mind,â€ a curiosity podcast, examines just how weird reality is with hosts Robert Lamb and Joe McCormick.
â€œNew Rory & MAL,â€ the culture and sports podcast featuring Jamil â€˜Malâ€™ Clay and Rory Farrell always bringing the hottest takes.
â€œ3 and Out with John Middlekauff,â€ the sports podcast features former NFL scout John Middleauff giving his unique perspective on college and professional football.
â€œBuried Bones,â€ a history and true crime podcast, features journalist Kate Winkler Dawson and retired investigator Paul Holes dissecting the most compelling cases from centuries ago.

schema.headline: Netflix Inks iHeartMedia Deal for Exclusive Video Podcasts Featuring Charlamagne tha God, Chelsea Handler and More

title: Instagram for TV: Social Network Launches App to Watch Reels Videos on Big Screen
description: Instagram is making the jump from mobile devices to the living-room TV for the first time â€” a bid to ratchet up viewing of short-form Reels, by taki
body:
Instagram is making the jump from mobile devices to the living-room TV for the first time â€” a bid to ratchet up viewing of short-form Reels, by taking videos to the biggest screen in the house.

	The Meta-owned social platform on Tuesday launched a pilot of Instagram for TV, an app designed to display Reels on connected TVs. It is initially available for Amazonâ€™s Fire TV family of devices and only in the U.S.; Instagram expects to widen support for additional devices and launch in additional markets next year.
	

	But how many people will actually want to use Instagram for TV? The company says it has feedback that thereâ€™s a healthy appetite for such a use case.


	â€œWe have seen a ton of demand from people on Instagram to watch Reels on TV,â€ said Tessa Lyons-Laing, VP of product for Instagram. â€œWe hear all the time that people get together with theyâ€™re friends to watch Reels. Itâ€™s fun to connect with your friends about this stuff.â€

	Initially, there will not be any advertising on the Instagram for TV app, but thatâ€™s something the company will consider going forward, said Lyons-Laing.

	Aidan Marcuss, VP of Fire TV devices at Amazon, commented on the Instagram for TV app launch, â€œWeâ€™re committed to keep pushing the boundaries of entertainment on customersâ€™ biggest screens â€” the Instagram team has built an awesome experience, and weâ€™re excited to be the first place to offer it.â€

	Note that â€œInstagram for TVâ€ is different from the previous â€œIGTVâ€ initiative. Originally launched in 2018, IGTV was not on television sets: It was meant to spur the creation of longer-form video on Instagram, of videos up to 15 minutes in length. (Reels can be up to 3 minutes in length.) The project was phased out in 2022, as Instagram focused on expanding Reels, Metaâ€™s TikTok-like short-form video format. Now, Instagram is taking Reels to HDTVs to try to carve out some share of big-screen viewing time.
	

	According to Instagram, IG for TV is personalized for individual users, based on the content and creators they follow and engage with. In the connected-TV app, you can explore channels and categories â€” from trending comedy and sports to music and lifestyle â€” with Reels grouped together to make it easier to browse. When you select a channel or creator to watch, the Instagram Reels and Stories will autoplay one after the other. Itâ€™s the first time Reels content will be organized like this, Lyons-Laing said: â€œWeâ€™ve made a lot of progress understanding content clusters. That hasnâ€™t existed before on Instagram.â€

	The Instagram for TV app also shows you Reels that are popular among your friends, and thereâ€™s a search feature. The Instagram for TV app allows you to add up to five accounts on one home screen, and you can even create a new account just for TV viewing.

	Instagram released a video clip showing how the connected-TV app works:

schema.headline: Instagram for TV: Social Network Launches App to Watch Reels Videos on Big Screen

title: â€˜The Pittâ€™ Season 2 Trailer: Dr. Robby Clashes With His Replacement During Chaotic Fourth of July Rush
description: HBO Max has released a new trailer and key art for â€œThe Pittâ€ Season 2, which premieres Jan. 8 at 9 p.m. ET. New episodes of the 15-episode season w
body:
HBO Max has released a new trailer and key art for â€œThe Pittâ€ Season 2, which premieres Jan. 8 at 9 p.m. ET. New episodes of the 15-episode season will premiere weekly until the season finale on April 16.

	According to a series logline, â€œâ€™The Pittâ€™ is a realistic examination of the challenges facing healthcare workers in todayâ€™s America as seen through the lens of the frontline heroes working in a modern-day hospital in Pittsburgh.â€ Season 1 took place on the day of a major music festival, while Season 2 is set to take place on the Fourth of July.
	

	Star Noah Wyle, who plays Dr. Michael â€œRobbyâ€ Robinavitch, revealed at Augustâ€™s Televerse TV Festival that the new season will also tackle recent changes to the American healthcare system.


	â€œBefore we even start to write, weâ€™re conducting interviews with all sorts of people from every sector and vector of healthcare, and they tell us what theyâ€™re up against,â€ he said. â€œThey tell us what they would love to see on TV, and they tell us what would really be counterproductive to what theyâ€™re trying to do if we put it on TV.â€

	Other cast members include Patrick Ball (Dr. Langdon), Katherine LaNasa (Dana Evans), Supriya Ganesh (Dr. Mohan), Fiona Dourif (Dr. McKay), Taylor Dearden (Dr. King), Isa Briones (Dr. Santos), Gerran Howell (Whitaker), Shabana Azeez (Javadi) and Sepideh Moafi (Dr. Al-Hashimi).

	On Monday, Luke Tennie (Dr. Crus Henderson), Travis Van Winkle (Curtis Larson), Meta Golding (Noelle Hastings) and Christopher Thornton (Dr. Caleb Jefferson) joined the cast for Season 2.
	

	â€œThe Pittâ€ was created by R. Scott Gemmill, who serves as executive producer alongside John Wells, Wyle, Erin Jontow, Jow Sachs, Simran Baidwan and Michael Hissrich. John Wells Productions serves as producer in association with Warner Bros. Television, where the banner has an overall deal.

	Check out the trailer and key art for â€œThe Pittâ€ Season 2 below.

schema.headline: â€˜The Pittâ€™ Season 2 Trailer: Dr. Robby Clashes With His Replacement During Chaotic Fourth of July Rush

title: â€˜The Traitorsâ€™ Season 4 Trailer: Provocateur Michael Rapaport Stirs Up Drama as Lisa Rinna Cackles
description: Peacock has released the trailer for â€œThe Traitorsâ€ Season 4. The new season premieres with three extended episodes on Jan. 8 at 6 p.m. PT, followed
body:
Peacock has released the trailer for â€œThe Traitorsâ€ Season 4. The new season premieres with three extended episodes on Jan. 8 at 6 p.m. PT, followed by two more episodes on Jan. 15. New episodes will then premiere every Thursday through the finale and the reunion will take place on Feb. 26.

	Alan Cumming returns as host for Season 4. Cast members include Candiace Dillard Bassett (â€œThe Real Housewives of Potomacâ€), Caroline Stanbury (â€œThe Real Housewives of Dubaiâ€), Colton Underwood (â€œThe Bachelorâ€), Donna Kelce (Travis and Jason Kelceâ€™s mom), Dorinda Medley (â€œThe Real Housewives of New York Cityâ€), Eric Nam (singer-songwriter), Ian Terry (â€œBig Brotherâ€), Johnny Weir (Olympic figure skater), Kristen Kish (host, â€œTop Chefâ€) Rob Cesternino (â€œSurvivorâ€), Lisa Rinna (â€œThe Real Housewives of Beverly Hillsâ€), Mark Ballas (â€œDancing With the Starsâ€), Maura Higgins (â€œLove Island USA Aftersunâ€), Michael Rapaport (actor), MonÃ©t X Change (â€œRuPaulâ€™s Drag Raceâ€), Natalie Anderson (â€œSurvivorâ€), Porsha Williams (â€œThe Real Housewives of Atlantaâ€), Rob Rausch (â€œLove Island USAâ€), Ron Funches (comedian), Stephen Colletti (â€œOne Tree Hillâ€), Tara Lipinski (Olympic figure skater), Tiffany Mitchell (â€œBig Brotherâ€) and Yamil â€œYam Yamâ€ Arocho (â€œSurvivorâ€).
	

	Season 3, which was nominated for five Emmys, ended in a four-way win between Dolores Catania, Dylan Efron, Gabby Windey and Ivar Mountbatten. They split a pot of $204,300 after eliminating traitors Britney Haynes and Danielle Reyes. 


	Stephen Lambert, Mike Cotton, Sam Rees-Jones, Rosie Franks, Tim Harcourt, Jack Burgess, Darrell Olsen and Cumming serve as executive producers. Studio Lambert, part of All3 Media, produces the show. 
	

	Check out the trailer for â€œThe Traitorsâ€ Season 4 below.

schema.headline: â€˜The Traitorsâ€™ Season 4 Trailer: Provocateur Michael Rapaport Stirs Up Drama as Lisa Rinna Cackles

title: â€˜Zootopia 2â€™ Leads U.K., Ireland Box Office as â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ Looms
description: Disneyâ€™s â€œZootopia 2â€ retained the No. 1 spot at the U.K. and Ireland box office for a third weekend, adding Â£2.7 million ($3.7 million) and lifting
body:
Disneyâ€™s â€œZootopia 2â€ retained the No. 1 spot at the U.K. and Ireland box office for a third weekend, adding Â£2.7 million ($3.7 million) and lifting its cumulative total to Â£15.5 million ($20.9 million), according to Comscore.

	Universalâ€™s â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ held firmly in second place, grossing $2.5 million in its fourth frame. The musical sequel has now amassed $54.9 million, cementing its position as one of the territoryâ€™s top-grossing releases of the year. Also for Universal, â€œFive Nights at Freddyâ€™s 2â€ ranked third, delivering $1.3 million in its sophomore outing for a $7.1 million cume.
	

	Moviegoers Entertainmentâ€™s Bollywood action title â€œDhurandharâ€ placed fourth with $801,530, pushing its two-week total to $1.6 million. New release â€œFackham Hall,â€ from Entertainment Film Distributors, debuted in fifth place with Â£$549,458.


	Event cinema remained a fixture in the chart, with Trafalgar Releasingâ€™s â€œThe Nutcracker â€“ ROH, London 2025 (Ballet)â€ landing in sixth on $303,826, bringing its total to $1.04 million. Lionsgate U.K.â€™s â€œNow You See Me: Now You Donâ€™tâ€ followed in seventh, adding $291,738 for a cumulative $8.8 million.

	Studiocanalâ€™s seasonal slasher â€œSilent Night, Deadly Nightâ€ opened in eighth place with $247,308, narrowly ahead of A24â€™s â€œEternity,â€ which earned $244,819 in its second weekend for $1.1 million total. Rounding out the top 10, Park Circusâ€™ perennial favorite â€œHome Aloneâ€ returned once again to the chart, grossing $244,753 and lifting its total to $5.1 million.

	Looking ahead, the pre-Christmas frame brings a trio of wide-ranging arrivals on Friday, Dec. 19. Disney rolls out James Cameronâ€™s next Pandora chapter, â€œAvatar: Fire And Ash,â€ which is set for a major U.K.-Ireland launch across 300+ locations. 
	

	Also opening is Eugene Jareckiâ€™s documentary â€œThe Six Billion Dollar Man: Julian Assange and the Price of Truth,â€ released by Charlotte Street Films, which examines the WikiLeaks founderâ€™s case and broader questions of press freedom through interviews with figures including Assange himself, Edward Snowden and Naomi Klein. Rounding out the day is family-friendly animation â€œSuper Elfkins,â€ handled by Miracle Comms.

schema.headline: â€˜Zootopia 2â€™ Leads U.K., Ireland Box Office as â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ Looms

title: â€˜Holy Spiderâ€™ Actress Zar Amir, Jonathan Pryce and Amir El-Masry Lead Cast of Thriller â€˜Keep Her Quietâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Iranian-French actress Zar Amir, who won Cannesâ€™ best actress award for â€œHoly Spider,â€ leads the cast of investigative thriller â€œKeep Her Quiet,â€ al
body:
Iranian-French actress Zar Amir, who won Cannesâ€™ best actress award for â€œHoly Spider,â€ leads the cast of investigative thriller â€œKeep Her Quiet,â€ alongside British actor Jonathan Pryce, an Oscar nominee with â€œThe Two Popes,â€ and rising Egyptian-British actor Amir El-Masry, who starred in â€œLimboâ€ and â€œGiant.â€

	Also in the cast are Uyghur actress Bahargul Basco, the U.K.â€™s Hiftu Quasem, and Canadaâ€™s Eleanor Matsuura.
	

	The film is directed by Franz BÃ¶hm, who won a BAFTA for short film â€œRock, Paper, Scissors,â€ and is co-directed by Uyghur filmmaker Suli Kurban. The screenplay is written by Samuel Gheist, Kurban and BÃ¶hm.


	Based on a true story, the film follows a Washington, D.C.-based journalist whose investigation into unexplained disappearances in Western China puts her and her family in danger.

	Principal photography recently wrapped across locations in Germanyâ€™s Baden-WÃ¼rttemberg and Bavaria, as well as Washington, D.C.

	The film is produced by the German-Austrian production outfit Schubert, led by Johannes Schubert. Production partners include Switzerlandâ€™s Stefan Eichenberger of Contrast Film, Swedenâ€™s Erik Hemmendorff (â€œTriangle of Sadness,â€ â€œThe Squareâ€) of Plattform Produktion, and Austriaâ€™s David Bohun and Lixi Frank of Panama Film.

	The executive producers are Malte Grunert, producer of the Academy Award-winning â€œAll Quiet on the Western Front,â€ Anita Gou (â€œThe Farewellâ€) and Caroline Clark of Kindred Spirit, as well as Kristina BÃ¶rjeson of Film i VÃ¤st.

	Theatrical distribution in German-speaking territories will be handled by Pandora Film (Germany), Filmladen Filmverleih (Austria), and Filmcoopi ZÃ¼rich (Switzerland).
	

	The production is a collaboration with a public broadcaster alliance led by Germanyâ€™s SWR, alongside BR and ARTE, as well as Austriaâ€™s ORF and Switzerlandâ€™s SRF. Support comes from MFG Film Fund Baden-WÃ¼rttemberg, FilmFernsehFonds Bavaria, Bayerischer Bankenfonds, Hessen Film & Medien, German Federal Film Board (FFA), Austrian Film Institute, Vienna Film Fund, Federal Office of Culture (BAK) and Zurich Film Fund.

schema.headline: â€˜Holy Spiderâ€™ Actress Zar Amir, Jonathan Pryce and Amir El-Masry Lead Cast of Thriller â€˜Keep Her Quietâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: â€˜Birds of Warâ€™ Boarded by Dogwoof Ahead of World Premiere at Sundance Film Festival (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Dogwoof has picked up world sales rights to the feature documentary â€œBirds of War,â€ which will world premiere at the Sundance Film Festival in the W
body:
Dogwoof has picked up world sales rights to the feature documentary â€œBirds of War,â€ which will world premiere at the Sundance Film Festival in the World Cinema Documentary Competition.

	The film tells the love story of London-based Lebanese journalist Janay Boulos and Syrian-based activist/cameraman Abd Alkader Habak, delving into their personal archive across 13 years of revolutions, war and exile. The film is directed by Boulos and Habak â€“ their feature debut â€“ and is produced by Sonja Henrici, Boulos and Habak.
	

	â€œ â€˜Birds of Warâ€™ is an extraordinary, intimate love story forged in the shadow of conflict,â€ said Dogwoof CCO Oli Harbottle. â€œTold through years of personal archives, it brings rare emotional clarity to war, exile and the cost of bearing witness.â€


	Henrici commented, â€ â€˜Birds of Warâ€™ uses Janay and Habakâ€™s intimate archive to tell stories that news coverage simply misses. I canâ€™t wait to share this film with audiences in 2026 when the filmâ€™s central question is ever more prominent in our minds: How can we be together despite our differences?â€

	â€œIn crafting â€˜Birds of War,â€™ we embarked on a journey that transcends borders and political narratives, weaving our love story through the wars, revolutions, and shifting realities of Lebanon and Syria,â€ Boulos and Habak wrote. â€œThe film mirrors the complexities of the region we call home, yet it is ultimately a deeply human exploration of connection, an insistence that love can grow even in the most fractured landscapes.â€

	Habak continued, â€œ â€˜Birds of Warâ€™ captures how conflict reshapes relationships, identity, and belonging, across borders.â€
	

	Boulos added. â€œThis film is an intimate chronicle of love, displacement, and survival, shaped by years of revolution and exile, while rooted deep in our lived experience of history unfolding in real time.â€

	Mark Thomas of Screen Scotland, which supported the film, added: â€œThe film is the powerful and emotional love story of directors Janay and Habak, whose chance meeting in the midst of the chaos of conflict, changes the course of their lives.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Birds of Warâ€™ Boarded by Dogwoof Ahead of World Premiere at Sundance Film Festival (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Hayley Williams, Florence Welch, Trey Anastasio and More Light Up Jack Antonoffâ€™s Ally Coalition Benefit Concert
description: Jack Antonoffâ€™s annual benefit concert for the Ally Coalition â€” his and his sister Rachelâ€™s charitable organization, which has raised over $2 millio
body:
Jack Antonoffâ€™s annual benefit concert for the Ally Coalition â€” his and his sister Rachelâ€™s charitable organization, which has raised over $2 million to support unhoused LGBTQ+ youths â€”Â has featured so many stars over its 11 editions that itâ€™s hard to remember them all: Over the years weâ€™ve seen Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey (on the same night), Sabrina Carpenter (singing a â€œChristmas versionâ€ of â€œPlease Please Pleaseâ€), Lorde, Kacey Musgraves, Phishâ€™s Trey Anastasio, St. Vincent, Phoebe Bridgers, Lucy Dacus, Clairo, Brittany Howard, the (Dixie) Chicks, Jason Isbell and many other Antonoff collaborators or adjacent people perform at the event, which features his versatile group Bleachers as the house band and annual co-headiner.
	

	Monday nightâ€™s Ally Coalition Talent Show, held at the eventâ€™s home base of New York Universityâ€™s Skirball Center, was no exception, with appearances from Hayley Williams, Florence and the Machine frontperson Florence Welch, Anastasio (all pictured above with Antonoff), Rachel Zegler and more.




	

					From left: Jack Antonoff, Florence Welch, Claud, Samia, Rachel Zegler, Hayley Williams and various Bleachers  (Photo by Taylor Hill/Getty Images for Ally Coalition)
									Getty Images for Ally Coalition
	



	The guests, who perform two or three songs each and often join others, are never announced in advance, so every year features a mix of perennial performers â€”Â singer-songwriter Claud said it was their seventh appearance; Anastasio first performed there in 2022 â€”Â and newcomers, most of whom have recently been in Antonoffâ€™s orbit. Williams performed with him at Rolling Stoneâ€™s â€œMusicians on Musiciansâ€ concert last month; he co-wrote and co-produced Welchâ€™s 2022 album â€œDance Fever.â€ The looseness of the show is reflected in Antonoffâ€™s frequent stage directions, which are often audibles like â€œIs he ready?â€ and â€œShould we flip them?â€
	

	The show is also interspersed with brief sets from comedians; Tuesday nightâ€™s included Mike Birbiglia, Chris Laker and Chris Fleming, all of whom were good, although the latter brought the house down with his self-deprecating, highly physical humor.



	

					Rachel Zegler (Photo by Taylor Hill/Getty Images for Ally Coalition)
									Getty Images for Ally Coalition
	



	The show may be fun and funny, but the cause is serious: In addition to the concert, the Ally Coalition held its fourth annual Day of Services in New York last Friday, bringing together local LGBTQ organizations, medical service organizations, and clothing brands to support the at-risk and homeless youth in the community. It also went on tour last year, with Lucy Dacus, Ethel Cain, Djo, Remi Wolf, TV On The Radio, Grizzly Bear, Lauren Mayberry, Joy Oladokun, and others, and hosted service projects at The Grammy Museum and at LGBTQ+ Centers with Maren Morris to pack hygiene kits for LGBTQ+ youth.



	

					Hayley Williams (Photo by Taylor Hill/Getty Images for Ally Coalition)
									Getty Images for Ally Coalition
	



	Monday eveningâ€™s show began with a song from Bleachers, followed by two from Andrew Dost, his erstwhile bandmate in the group Fun. â€”Â the short-lived Grammy-winning trio that launched Antonoff to stardom â€”Â who plays at the top of the show nearly every year.

	Next up were Claud, Samia, Hank, and Annie DeRusso with a harmony-filled, hilariously profane anti-holiday song about bringing a love interest to meet the family called â€œJesus Fucking Christmasâ€ â€” not to be confused with the South Park anthem, â€œMerry Fucking Christmasâ€ â€” that includes the priceless lyric, â€œThe barâ€™s not even high/ You were two hours late last time/ And you smell like weed, and my parents think youâ€™re useless.â€




	Singer-songwriter Kelsey Lu followed with a pair of songs before a comedy interlude that led into the showâ€™s big finale, as Bleachers took the stage and performed first with Antonoffâ€™s sister-in-law, Rainey Qualley, then a pair with Anastasio, then Rachel Zegler, star of â€œRomeo and Julietâ€ (for which Antonoff wrote the music), who sang a lovely version of Joni Mitchellâ€™s holiday-themed â€œRiver,â€ in a range much lower than Joniâ€™s.

	Next up, Hayley Williams, clad in a tight leather skirt and four-inch heels, rocketed across the stage and launched into â€œKill Meâ€ and â€œGood Olâ€™ Daysâ€ from her Grammy-nominated new solo album, â€œEgo Death at the Bachelorette Party.â€ She stepped into a backing vocal role when Florence â€”Â who created quite a contrast in her trademark flowing white gown and Stevie Nicks-meets-Lady Macbeth stage moves â€”Â took the lead for â€œFreeâ€ and her signature song, â€œThe Dog Days Are Over.â€
	



	

					Florence Welch (Photo by Taylor Hill/Getty Images for Ally Coalition)
									Getty Images for Ally Coalition
	



	The show wound down with an all-cast cover of Judee Sillâ€™s classic â€œLopinâ€™ Along Through the Cosmos,â€ and closed, as it did last year, with Antonoffâ€™s own â€œMerry Christmas, Please Donâ€™t Call.â€

	While the show is loose and familial â€” although Antonoffâ€™s sister and father, who usually perform, were absent due to the flu â€”Â itâ€™s a monumental undertaking for an unimpeachable cause.

schema.headline: Hayley Williams, Florence Welch, Trey Anastasio and More Light Up Jack Antonoffâ€™s Ally Coalition Benefit Concert

title: Influencer Aline Cristina Dalmolin Dead After Catastrophic Car Crash
description:
Brazilian Influencer
                          Aline Cristina Dalmolin Dead After Horrific Car Cr
body:
Brazilian Influencer
                          Aline Cristina Dalmolin Dead After Horrific Car Crash
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 16, 2025
                            6:51 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 16, 2025
                                7:32 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Popular business influencer Aline Cristina Dalmolin has tragically died after a horrific Porsche crash ... with the driver allegedly drunk and bolting from the scene.
      
    
          The 41-year-old internet personality was riding as a passenger when the car slammed into a utility pole at high speed in the early hours of Monday morning in BalneÃ¡rio CamboriÃº, Brazil ... leaving her with catastrophic injuries -- including a severed arm and severe head injuries.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Aline didnâ€™t make it to the hospital ... she suffered multiple cardiac arrests on the way and was pronounced dead en route.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The 57-year-old driver reportedly walked away without a scratch -- apparently drunk -- before taking off on foot. Cops say they later tracked him down hiding in a nearby mangrove area, where a police spokesperson noted he was showing "clear signs of intoxication, such as slurred speech, difficulty walking, the smell of alcohol, and disorientation."
      

                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The relationship between Aline and the driver remains unclear. Heâ€™s been arrested and is now facing charges of manslaughter while driving under the influence.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Aline ran the sports company Celd Esportes and was also a life coach who inspired thousands online.
      
    
          She was 41.
      
    
          RIP

description:

body:
Philippines
                          Slam Dunk ...
                          Twerking Woman Brings Down Basketball Hoop
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 16, 2025
                            6:21 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
        
                    
                  
      
    
          A woman in the Philippines went viral after she showed off some butt-wigglin' moves on a basketball hoop ... before it came crashing down and slammed her to the pavement.
      
    
          Check out the video -- the woman climbs up to the hoop as a crowd cheers her on. She makes her way onto the rim, where she starts twerkin' for her fans below ... but her fun quickly turns into disaster when the pole breaks and the entire structure comes tumbling down.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The woman goes down with it, landing flat on her back, knocking the wind out of her.
      
    
          Leave the above-the-rim antics to the pros!

title: Cardi B Supports Stefon Diggs During Holiday Event at Gillette Stadium
description:
Cardi B
                          Yoga With Diggs At Holiday Event
                          ...
body:
Cardi B
                          Yoga With Diggs At Holiday Event
                          ... Namast-bae!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 16, 2025
                            6:58 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Cardi B and Stefon Diggs drew a massive crowd for the Patriots receiver's holiday event at Gillette Stadium ... with the rapper going all-out in support of her man -- even doing some yoga poses in the process!!
      
    
          The NFL star held a "Wellness Wonderland" women's function on Monday ... explaining, "I want to take some time to appreciate some hardworking women in the world and their little ones."
      
    
      
      Stefon Diggs and Cardi B. doing some yoga during a night of winter wellness here at Gillette Stadium for local moms and their kids pic.twitter.com/CkTFpxU8jAâ€” Meghan Ottolini (@Meghan_Ottolini) December 16, 2025
              @Meghan_Ottolini
          
  
    
          That included Cardi -- his girlfriend and the mother of his son -- who got directly involved by joining Diggs on the mats for the event's yoga session.
      

          The "Safe" rapper also took time to meet all of Diggs' fans ... and judging by the videos, the love was mutual. Moms and kids crowded around Diggs and Cardi, with the couple all smiles, hugging each other tightly.
      
    
      
      Stefon Diggs and Cardi B. have a LOT of fans at this event in Gillette Stadium! pic.twitter.com/GF1wOS4Vshâ€” Meghan Ottolini (@Meghan_Ottolini) December 16, 2025
              @Meghan_Ottolini
          
  
    
          Cardi shared her own footage of Diggs' wellness event on her Instagram ... showing the four-time Pro Bowler signing autographs for the kids and telling him to pose for the camera,
      
    
          These two lovebirds have quickly become a fan-favorite since going public with their relationship ... with rumors of them dating starting in 2024.
      
    
          Since then, the couple has continued to share glimpses of their love life with fans, from posting PDA moments to a photo of their son, who was born on November 4, 2025.
      
    
        
                    
                  
      
    
          Judging by their grins and how they hold each other down, this power couple is only gettin' started!!

title: Howard Stern Extends SiriusXM Contract for Three More Years
description:
Howard Stern
                          Mic Drop Delayed ... Contract Extended
body:
Howard Stern
                          Mic Drop Delayed ... Contract Extended
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 16, 2025
                            7:13 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          In the immortal words of "The Wolf of Wall Street" -- "I'm not f***ing leaving!" ... and neither is Howard Stern, thanks to a contract extension he just announced on "The Howard Stern Show."
      
    
          The 71-year-old radio host has signed on with SiriusXM for another three years, ending much speculation about his retirement.
      
    
          The icon said, â€œI am happy to announce that I have figured out a way to have it all ... More free time and continuing to be on the radio. Yes, we are coming back for three years.â€
      
    
          The extension comes after Stern re-upped for five years in 2020 for a sum that reportedly amounted to between $450 million and $500 million.
      

          He admitted, â€œI do like my days off. You know me, Iâ€™m never bored. Iâ€™m busy every minute. I need me time. Iâ€™ve never had me time. Iâ€™ve been working my whole life. Never really having a personal life. I thought maybe at this point in my life, I could have some free time. It would be sad, but exciting for me."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          He continued, â€œI was really torn up. I still do love being on the radio. I think the show is better than ever.â€
      
    
          Stern shared his schedule will include summers off and limited trips to SiriusXM's NYC studios, offering him plenty of flexibility.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    The Howard Stern Show/SiriusXM
          
    
          Earlier this year, Stern trolled fans by leading them to believe Andy Cohen was taking over his show. Cohen hopped on the mic and joked the show would now be called "Andy 100" before Stern stepped in to reveal it was a prank.
      
    
          At the end of the extension, Stern will have been on SiriusXM for 22 years. "The Howard Stern Show" debuted on the satellite radio service in 2006 after initially signing with them in 2004.

schema.headline: Howard Stern Extends SiriusXM Contract for Three More Years
